website_summaries.verdict: Extremely thorough and detailed, this guide is known for fantastic color plates. There's almost too much information for field use, but it's great once you're back at home.
pros: Field guide with more than  1,000 photographs of the butterflies of North America north of Mexico
Includes true butterflies and common skippers as well as migrants and strays
Color plates visually arranged by shape and color
Thumb-tab silhouettes give convenient field index
Includes size, life cycle, habitat and other markers
cons: Too much flipping to find pictures that match the descriptions

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice color pictures and great descriptions. The only thing is you have to flip 100's of pages away to get the description to match the picture. Very difficult to use in my opinion. Great for sitting and reading through when bored, but not that great for field use. I am used to guides that have images on one page and the description either on the same page or next page so there is no fumbling around.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive Guide to US Butterflies
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice guide including eggs, caterpillars and chrysalises as well as mature butterflies with crisp macro photographs, each being well cropped to concentrate on the creature full frame. Excellent field notes for each species. Easy to use index. Nice size to tote on a field trip; however, I use mine at home to identify the butterflies I photograph. Would really like to find equally excellent guides to butterflies in other parts of the world... Also would like a similar book on Moths...
customer_reviews.author: Allan G. Farman

customer_reviews.title: Book— perfect. Shipping—meh.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing resource for tracking butterflies from caterpillar to metamorphasized masterpiece. Excellent photos and descriptions. Would have 5 stars except the book was damaged during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Reader

customer_reviews.title: No caterpillar information
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed when I realized that it doesn't include photos/information for caterpillars to match with the butterfly. There's a small set of photos of caterpillars, but not a 1-1 match with the butterflies, so it's hard to use to match them up.

customer_reviews.title: The Audubon books are a must have for all wildlife rookies and  experts
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country and we love the presence of all types of wildlife. We have the majority of all the Audubon books so we can use them to identify unknowed creatures. The series of books are fabulous and provides all the details, and more information than we can absorb. Highly recommend this series of books for those wildlife enthusiasts
customer_reviews.author: TStout

customer_reviews.title: Photos Not Drawings
customer_reviews.text: Photographs actually make ID a little harder than drawings. I think I would buy a different book for that reason. However, there are lots of full color pictures, including caterpillars, etc., that help identification at all stages of life. Lots of information about migration as well.
customer_reviews.author: Duchess of Toad Manor

customer_reviews.title: Great Audubon book.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, as I do all my Audubon books, just wish it included mothers in with the butterflies. Combination books with both butterflies and moths are difficult to find
customer_reviews.author: Buystoomuch

customer_reviews.title: wonderful resource for the amateur naturalist
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like butterflies? My backyard is a welcome haven for these fanciful little creatures and this field guide gives me great information about their habits and habitat. My sustainable environment project benefits from the knowledge gleaned from this guide.
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: A butterfly nerd's delight!
customer_reviews.text: I love butterflies and was able to identify a few around my home. This book is a game changer. I love being able to pack this book around with me and identify on the spot. The photos are beautiful and the book seems fairly thorough.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed with the pictures... there should have been more and showing the wings open and closed...
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent guide for accurately identifying butterflies
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this field guide for our butterfly-loving daughter for her birthday and she loves it! She works at a wildlife center where she frequently turns to Audubon field guides for identifying and learning about various wildlife and so requested this one for her personal use in identifying butterflies in her area. She is very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Lots of information
customer_reviews.text: The photos are beautiful, and there’s so much to learn about butterflies!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Nice Reference
customer_reviews.text: A terrific book I would definitely recommend to all nature lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Salniker

customer_reviews.title: Up to the usual Audubon Society high standards
customer_reviews.text: I use both Audubon Society and Petersons small wildlife identification guides and find that are quite good with their own plus and minuses. Petersons is better for taking into the field for things that move (animals and insects) due to the layout which allows for quicker identification. Audubon is better for things that can't get away (plants) and with animals and insects, for obtaining data about the creature's habitat. This guide is as good as any other in their series, which is to say that it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Network Guy

customer_reviews.title: A good basic guide
customer_reviews.text: These audubon guides are good basic guides. We got them to identify butterflies, insects and spiders in our midwestern back yard. It is often difficult to find the bugs we are looking for. We've had much more luck with Kenn Kaufman's "Field Guide to Insects of North America". In some ways it's more user friendly, with lots of bugs photos on one page and descriptions that are on the opposing text page. The Audubon guide is set up so that you have to flip back and forth between images in one section and text/description in another - which can be tedious - however, the Audubon descriptions are much more thorough than Kaufman's.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Moreton

customer_reviews.title: Wealth of information
customer_reviews.text: Has helped me identify some of my local fluttering friends
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A perfect book for anyone who wants to identify local butterflies.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for a butterfly loving friend. Easy to use and bright pictures that make identification easy. Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portable reference!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second copy of this book I have purchased. My 13yo nature-lover refers to it often. However, he lost his original copy and insisted he had to have another. Of course, two weeks after we replaced it the old one was found on his sister's bookshelf! The photographs are beautifully detailed, it is small enough to fit in a backpack, and the cover is quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: swim mom

customer_reviews.title: Junk don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The photos and colors are poor. They all seem to have the same green background. The information about the butterfly is separate from the photograph. You have to search twice for the information.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great Butterfly Field guide
customer_reviews.text: Another great field guide from The National Audubon Society. The only problem I had is the butterflies would not sit still long enough to look them up... so I took photos and then looked them up at my leisure. This made it much easier to determine the subtle differences between various butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Geneva

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a surprise gift for my husband. He has several of the National Audubon Books and I want him to eventually have the entire set. The pictures are beautiful, and it is easy for him to look up the butterflies in our backyard. This spring and summer this book has been in major use. This is a great buy for anyone who loves the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Alli K

customer_reviews.title: Good resource for the butterfly lover
customer_reviews.text: Very nice compilation - book is a little heavy due to the large number of color plates.
customer_reviews.author: Foxglove

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleased with this book. Great photos. Soft cover is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dee W

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: I love these field guides. They are compact, full of information, contain high quality photos of each entry to make identification unmistakable, and contain every butterfly I have ever needed to look up. These may be the best field guides out there.
customer_reviews.author: BerryPatch01

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for butterfly lovers.
customer_reviews.text: Colorful , easy to read, even the cover is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Verified customer

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society Pocket Guide to Familiar Butterflies of North America
customer_reviews.text: Iam very glad I purchased this book. It has beautiful pictures and a wealth of information. The shipping was done in a timely fashion. The book was in excellent condition and the price very reasonable. Will buy from this dealer again.
customer_reviews.author: cabill

customer_reviews.title: Great little book.
customer_reviews.text: Gift for granddaughter. Christmas present and would recommend this book
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cathy A. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly field guides
customer_reviews.text: Anything by the Audubon Society is great, but I really love the smaller field guides. I can take them with me anyplace. If I remember my small field glasses, I'm pretty much in Nerd heaven!
customer_reviews.author: mary l. allen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent transaction. Item as described and fast shipping. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Well done and helps identify the butterflies. And... that is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Images and Smart Descriptions
customer_reviews.text: A great field guide. Came as described online and without any damage, as new. Page after page of beautiful color images and large enough to have practical applications in identification. Great descriptions on basic information for each butterfly shown.
customer_reviews.author: EMcMurray13

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Chrismas present for my grandson who is 7. He had to show it to everyone he was in Love with the book. My husband, kids an 5 other grandkids would like one too. It is a book my husband an my grandson can both enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide!
customer_reviews.text: Though it took a bit longer than expected to arrive, i am very pleased. The color photos are great. Some times I wish it had the little map of the US to show the range of the butterflies, but this is not a big deal. Over all a great field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This field guide is very complete. It even has some of the caterpillars so you can identify the butterflies at all stages. Great for walks.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: A True Guide to Butterflies
customer_reviews.text: I wish to be known as Mr. Butterfly as one of my aliases one day, and thanks to this book I am well on my way. Informative, instructive, and inspiring. The photos included are fantastic as well! My only complaint is the vinyl cover, it doesn't care for cold weather. It tends to curl back towards the binding, leading to creases if you're not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: in minutes beginning with four Texas butterflies which took a little while I soon easily found my way around
customer_reviews.text: Superb book,more than met my expectations. I knew British butterflies but this book enables me to identify many, to me very strange butterflies, in minutes beginning with four Texas butterflies which took a little while I soon easily found my way around. Superb photographs and excellent descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs H Harris

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great guide for me, as I love to photograph butterflies. Now I can identify them and am amazed at the number of species in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L. Six

customer_reviews.title: Really good in the field
customer_reviews.text: Really good in the field. I've used it many times. Haven't seen a butterfly I could not identify yet.
customer_reviews.author: JoRo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my library. Will be a great learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: Erma L. Short

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society Butterfly Review
customer_reviews.text: Well the Audubon Society has a great reputation for these type of books and this book is no exception. Great photos in color full of detail. Loads of information on each species covered. I bought it with the idea of using some of the pictures for a tattoo design and this book did not let me down! If interested in learning about butterflies this is the book for you.
customer_reviews.author: Stoneheart

customer_reviews.title: Very Informative
customer_reviews.text: Most informative guide I have seen of North America's Butterflies. I have a nature page and this has helped me in my research.
customer_reviews.author: Bette (Jodie) Redditt

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift! Pictures and information are excellent for serious hobbyists as well as lay people who are beginners. Good resource!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Photographer's Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional student of nature. I use this Field Guide to identify butterflies on my photographic outings and find it very useful and easy to understand. The photos in it are very helpful in assisting amateurs like myself in the ID of butterflies. It's size is also a plus as I have to cart around too much photo gear to begins with and could not carry anything much larger than this guide. The price was also very reasonable. I would recommend this to any casual users who simply want primary names and info about butterfly species.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: The pictures are beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: Very informative book and will help me to know the differences between the species of butterflies. The pictures are beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Speedy Butterfly ID
customer_reviews.text: In Florida the butterflies are bountiful, greatly varied, and sometimes exotic. This wonderful layout and presentation of specific information has truly increased my enjoyment of our landscaping/gardening. Plus the book's size and vinyl cover work well on the lanai's small table!
customer_reviews.author: BK Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: I have had this book for myself for a few years and love it. I'm buying it for my grandchildren for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: PlainJane

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed in the content of this book
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in the content of this book. Not as much coverage as the other National Audubon books I have.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffles the Clown

customer_reviews.title: I like this guide and I used it for years before ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this guide and I used it for years before losing it. This is the second one for me. I am a wildlife biologist, not a lepidopterist. I rely on specialists for information. We all do. I would say that my specialty if habitat management. This butterfly guide is one of the good ones. I have to try Kaufmanns too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. King

customer_reviews.title: Book in great condition. Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Added to my collection. Book in great condition. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: D Graham

customer_reviews.title: patsyan
customer_reviews.text: The book is beautifully done, from the leather cover to the beautiful pictures of the butterflies and catepillars. The written information will very helpful in providing habitats and food supply for more butterflies around the area.
customer_reviews.author: patsyann

customer_reviews.title: We are so pleased
customer_reviews.text: The book is a wealth of information that we wanted, the ordering and delivery could not of been better.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl K.

customer_reviews.title: Just another winner from the National Audubon Society Book series
customer_reviews.text: This one was for me, well my husband and I and we both love it just like we love the other books in this series. We have also discovered that children who have access to the great outdoors adore these books as well as we have given them as successful gifts. They are great for outdoor family time as well as doing a little discovering on your own. Great descriptions and beautifully detailed pictures make these books tops in my opinion and that of the people whom we have give them to.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret O. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best resource for butterfly enthusiasts!
customer_reviews.text: Have other guides from NAS, I like the way this reference book is written, makes it easy to identity butterflies. My best butterfly resource I own.
customer_reviews.author: Djrharv

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reference guide to the identification of butterflies. Great photos and good descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: gretchen bartley

customer_reviews.title: present
customer_reviews.text: I never saw it again.mmmmmmmmmmmmmm m m m m m mmm m m m m m m m m m
customer_reviews.author: stephen willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great reference book...good pictures and detailed descriptions. Can't go wrong with Audobon-:)
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Clow

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Book was in pretty rough shape. Dust jacket was missing, pages dog-eared and some torn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... are older (somewhat out of date) these guides are great to me
customer_reviews.text: I have all of these series of field guides and even though they are older (somewhat out of date) these guides are great to me.
customer_reviews.author: Axiom Appellant
